roleset.name: acknowledge truth
roleset.note: ADMIT-V NOTES: Member of Vncls confess-37.10, conjecture-29.5-2. (from admit.01-v)
ADMISSION-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry admit.01, OntoNotes goruping admission-n sense 2; maps to VN entries confess-37.10, conjecture-29.5-2. Framed by Claire. (from admission.01-n)

example.name: admitted fragmentary S
example.text: The charity admits spending a lot on fund raising, but says that was necessary to establish a donor base it can tap at much lower cost in years to come.
example.arg: spending a lot on fund raising

example.name: admit a full S, inverted
example.text: ``[We've had a few bombs]-1,'' admits *trace*-1 Mr. Peters.

example.name: admit a PP
example.text: Ramon Garcia, the Asset Trust's executive trustee, admits to what he calls ``temporary setbacks.''
example.arg: Ramon Garcia, the Asset Trust's executive trustee,

example.name: with hearer
example.text: John admitted to Mary that he secretly loathed her haircut.
example.arg: that he secretly loathed her haircut

example.name: Arg0,1
example.text: Do the mavs want Josh Howard gone because of his admitting that he smokes weed in the off-season?
example.arg: that he smokes weed in the off-season

example.name: NP only args 0 & 1
example.text: any admission or denial of guilt by Mr. Holmes

example.name: Args 0 & 1
example.text: There was a tacit admission from John that things had gone wrong.

example.name: All arguments
example.text: Kemmick's blog entry starts with his admission of addiction to the Montana News.

roleset.name: allow to enter
roleset.note: ADMIT-V NOTES: Member of Vncls admit-65. (from admit.02-v)
ADMISSION-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry admit.02, OntoNotes grouping admission-n sense 1; Maps to VN entry admit-65. Framed by Claire. (from admission.02-n)

roles.note: No instance of arg0 found with noun, but you never know... (from admission.02-n)

example.name: with non-agentive cause as arg0
example.text: John's rugged good looks admit him to the highest circles of clandestine intelligence.
example.arg: to the highest circles of clandestine intelligence

example.name: agentive arg0
example.text: the doctors wouldn't admit him to the hospital

example.name: Arg0,1,2
example.text: Previous to their admitting him to the hospital, they had telephoned social services.

example.name: Location only
example.text: Their nation is seeking admission into the EU.

example.name: Location in pre-noun position
example.text: Her condition required frequent hospital admissions.

example.name: Args 1 & 2
example.text: Sally was a little jealous of Jane's admission to the Academy of Sciences.
